newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO seen down on crude losses, supplies.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO seen down on crude losses, supplies.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices on Wednesday were expected to ease with lower crude prices as well as unsold fuel oil supplies, traders said.
One trader said he expected offers to ease to $118 per tonne, down $1.00 from Tuesday's quotes for 180-cst cargoes lifting in November.
A trader said there were still unsold cargoes from Kuwait, Thailand and South Korea.
South Korea was offering at a premium of just under $1.00 to Singapore spot quotes for November lifting.
